formattedAddress: 180 Worth St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 180 Worth St, New York, NY 10038, USA

originalText.text: Absolutely rediculous. The attendant is horrible, and clearly doesn’t care about anything other than money. I was told upon parking, that the lot took Apple Pay, my only form of payment, however when I returned, they said that they didn’t take it, and he then kicked me out. If you don’t take Apple Pay, that’s fine, but put a sign up or say something.

text.text: Absolutely rediculous. The attendant is horrible, and clearly doesn’t care about anything other than money. originalText.text: Good location but unfortunately the attendants don’t give af. Stay away from here if you drive a Tesla. They didn’t give me back my key card and were more interested in getting tipped. I had to drive back to them couple days later to get my card which was then a nightmare to pick out of the OTHER 6-7 Tesla keycards that owners had forgotten with them. Terrible experience.

originalText.text:
This parking lot seems to be good choice for parking near Chinatown/CityHall.  It is located on the edge of Chinatown, thus not having to drive into the heart of Chinatown.  This makes it easier to get in and out of the lot without the nightmares of the crazy traffic that can come with going directly into Chinatown.

They do offer very reasonable weekend rates.  Weekday rates can be pricey.  Some garages use an elevator system, this one has ramps so this enables valets to park and retrieve your car much quicker.  I definitely prefer ramp system as I have had bad experience with elevator system lots which can take a long time to retrieve at peak times.

The valet ticket is very specific too.  It lists your plate number and car type so it helps valet better identify the correct car.  All these garages have a system, but I like how the ticket indicates your specific car.

I also like that they have a system where you can text the time that you are coming back to retrieve your car.  You enter your ticket number and pickup time and this will help them better to have your car ready when you arrive for pickup, thus speeding up your pickup time from this valet lot.

This is good choice for parking option in this area...and close to Chinatown/City Hall.

originalText.text: Good location for Chinatown meals and walk to Brooklyn Bridge. Nice staff. $25 for whole day weekend parking.

For one hour and a  weekend
DO NOT Park here - long waits
